english_translation: Narrated by Amr ibn Malik al-Ruasi: I came to the Messenger of Allah ﷺ and said to him: By Allah, verily the Lord is pleased so He becomes pleased. So be pleased with me. So he became pleased with him.

english_translation: Narrated by Nafi (grandfather of Alqamah): I was among the delegation. So Umar ibn Malik came to the Prophet ﷺ and embraced Islam. Then he called his people to Islam but they refused to answer him until they could avenge their blood feud. So they came to a group of Banu Uqail and injured one of them. Then Banu Uqail pursued them fighting them while among them was a man called Rabia ibn al-Mushfiq reciting poetry: I swear I will not thrust except at a horseman when the people are wearing helmets. A man from the tribe said: Are you safe for the rest of the day? He said: Then al-Muharrish ibn Abdullah resisted and we thrust twice. The Uqaili man thrust at his arm and severed it. He embraced his horse then said: O clan of Ruas. Rabia said: What is Ruas? A mountain or people? They came to Umar and the Prophet ﷺ with his hand shackled to his neck when he had done wrong. He came to Madina and heard youths saying when he came to Madina: If he comes to me with his hand shackled to his neck I will strike what is above the shackle. He came to the Prophet ﷺ from before him and said: O Messenger of Allah, be pleased with me. He turned away from him. He came to him from behind and said the same, then came to him from his right and left, then came to him from before and said: O Messenger of Allah, be pleased with me, may Allah be pleased with you, by Allah verily the Lord is pleased and He is pleased. He said: And I am pleased with you.

potential_issues.issue: Abu Awf Humaid ibn Abd al-Rahman and Nafi both use 'an transmission
potential_issues.impact: While both are graded as Thiqah/Saduq (reliable), the use of 'an creates ambiguity about direct hearing at these points.

potential_issues.issue: This is an exceptionally long narrative hadith
potential_issues.impact: Long hadiths with detailed narration are more susceptible to minor variations and additions across transmission chains. The narrative elements (poetry, dialogue) are particularly prone to variation.

potential_issues.issue: The hadith involves multiple stories and dialogues
potential_issues.impact: The complex narrative structure makes it difficult to trace exactly what portion relates to the Prophet ﷺ and what portion is contextual narrative.
